title:
Finite-Time Lyapunov Exponent Calculation on FPGA using High-Level
  Synthesis Tools
authors:
Manuel de Castro and Roberto R. Osorio and Francisco J. Andujar and
  Roc\'io Carratal\'a-S\'aez and Yuri Torres and Diego R. Llanos
abstract:
As Field Programmable Gate Arrays (FPGAs) computing capabilities continue to
grow, also does the interest on building scientific accelerators around them.
Tools like Xilinx's High-Level Synthesis (HLS) help to bridge the gap between
traditional high-level languages such as C and C++, and low-level hardware
description languages such as VHDL and Verilog. In this report, we study the
implementation of a fluid dynamics application, the Finite-Time Lyapunov
Exponent (FTLE) calculation, on FPGA using HLS. We provide speed and
resource-consumption results for 2- and 3-dimensional cases.
